alert.note: Alert for Jim Hogg; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 23 at 8:26PM CDT until May 23 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR WESTERN JIM HOGG AND CENTRAL ZAPATA COUNTIES... At 826 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Escobas, or 7 miles east of Bustamante, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Zapata, Bustamante, Medina, Zapata High School, Guerra, Zapata County Fire Department, Randado, Escobas, Zapata Middle School and Siesta Shores. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
